messages.title: Only a vote for Douglas Ross can beat the SNP here
messages.content: Only one vote can beat the SNP here in Moray – a vote for Scottish Conservative and Unionist candidate Douglas Ross. Nicola Sturgeon promised a ‘once in a generation’ referendum on independence would be held in a generation. But she has gone back on her word, and just last year held another divisive, unwanted campaign. Rather than listen to residents who don’t want her referendum, she has now said that her demand for another will be at the heart of her campaign. She wants to use this election to push even harder for an unwanted, divisive referendum on independence. So, unless people stand up to the SNP, we face yet more constitutional division and yet more uncertainty over our future.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Oppose SNP demands for a second independence referendum
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stand against misleading and divisive SNP policies affecting local services and the UK government forces.
Ensure we leave the disastrous Common Fisheries Policy to revitalise our fishing industry, ports, and coastal communities.
Stand up for local people affected by the decisions of the SNP government such as business rates and funding for local services.
Fight against further centralisation by the SNP, ensuring regional interests are protected.
Give Moray a voice and influence at the heart of government rather than simple shouting from the sidelines.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only one vote can beat the SNP here in Moray.

issues.brexitEurope: Ensure we leave the disastrous Common Fisheries Policy to revitalise our fishing industry, ports, and coastal communities.
issues.economy: Stand up for local people affected by the decisions of the SNP government such as the huge increase in business rates and the failure to deliver vital support payments for local farms.
issues.governance: Douglas has also been at the forefront of securing investment in Moray and improving education since the independence referendum in 2014.
issues.government: Douglas Ross has been a hard-working, campaigning local representative since he was elected to Moray Council in 2007 and has continued this style as an MSP. He has a reputation for putting the needs of the area first ahead of party politics. That’s why he’s delivered projects like the Western Link Road and has supported as many constituents as an MSP and Councillor.
issues.labourEmployment: Douglas understands the issues facing the UK MOD and the part played by defence in local employment.

community.content: Give Moray a voice and influence at the heart of government rather than simple shouting from the sidelines.

politicalExperience.achievements: Delivered projects like the Western Link Road and supported as many constituents as an MSP and Councillor.

quotes.text: Douglas on a visit to RAF Lossiemouth as the base prepares for significant investment by the UK Government.

images.caption: Douglas on a visit to RAF Lossiemouth as the base prepares for significant investment by the UK Government.

examples: Ensure we leave the disastrous Common Fisheries Policy to revitalise our fishing industry, ports, and coastal communities.
This is a clear choice where only one way to beat the SNP is by voting for Douglas Ross.
Oppose SNP demands for a second independence referendum which would bring more division and uncertainty over our future.
Stand up for local people affected by the decisions of the SNP government such as the huge increase in business rates and the failure to deliver vital support payments for local farms.
Fight against further centralisation by the SNP who seem more interested in the Central Belt of Scotland than Moray.
